verses.verse: For the director.[b] A song. A psalm. Shout joyfully to God, all the earth;[c]
sing to the glory of his name;[d] offer to him glorious praise.
Say to God: “How awesome are your deeds! Because of your great power, your enemies grovel before you.
The whole earth bows down in worship before you, singing praises to you, singing praises to your name.” Selah
Come and behold[e] the works of God, the awesome deeds he has done for people.
He changed the sea into dry land; they crossed the river[f] on foot. There we rejoiced in him,
for he rules forever by his power. His eyes keep watch over the nations so that the rebellious not exalt themselves. Selah
[g]Bless our God, all you peoples; let the sound of his praise be heard.
For he has preserved our lives[h] and has kept our feet from stumbling.
For you, O God, have put us to the test; you have purified us as silver is refined.
[i]You allowed us to be snared in the net and placed heavy burdens on our backs.
You let our captors ride over our heads,[j] and we went through fire and water, but now you have afforded us relief.
[k]I will enter your house with burnt offerings and carry out my vows to you,
the vows that my lips pronounced and my mouth promised when I was in distress.
I will offer burnt offerings of fat animals with the smoke of burning rams; I will sacrifice to you bulls and goats. Selah
Come and listen, all you who fear God, while I relate what he has done for me.
[l]I lifted up my voice in prayer to him; his praise[m] was on my tongue.
[n]If I had harbored evil in my heart, the LORD would not have listened.
But God truly did listen, and he was attentive to the words of my prayer.
Blessed[o] be God, because he did not reject my prayer or withhold his kindness from me.
